name: Push-up Rotations
how_to_perform:
1. Start in a push-up position with your hands shoulder-width apart and your body forming a straight line from head to heels.
2. Engage your core by pulling your belly button towards your spine, ensuring that your hips do not sag or pike upwards throughout the movement.
3. Lower your body down until your chest almost touches the ground, keeping your elbows close to your sides.
4. As you lower yourself, slowly rotate your torso to one side, keeping your arms and legs straight, so that your left (or right) shoulder almost touches the ground.
5. Pause briefly at the bottom of the rotation.
6. Push back up to the starting position.
7. Quickly switch sides by rotating your torso in the opposite direction, lowering yourself down with the other arm while the first arm is back in its original position.
8. Continue alternating between each side for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The push-up rotation exercise works multiple muscle groups, including the chest, shoulders, and triceps.
